metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4154 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A use-after-free flaw was found in cgroup1_parse_param inkernel/cgroup/cgroup-v1.c in the Linux kernel's cgroup v1 parser. A localattacker with a user privilege could cause a privilege escalation byexploiting the fsconfig syscall parameter leading to a container breakoutand a denial of service on the system.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
